intro: Cicer garanicum, commonly known as the Persian chickpea, is an annual legume native to the Middle East and Central Asia. It produces small, kidney-shaped seeds that are rich in protein and nutrients. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. It thrives in temperate climates and is well-suited for dry conditions due to its deep root system. The seeds are often used in traditional cuisines and are also valued for their agricultural benefits as a nitrogen-fixing crop.
